Title: 8 Minutes to Screen for Cognitive Impairment in Primary Care
Teaser: General practitioners found use of the Montreal Cognitive Assessment to be easy and fast, and the test had a high yield.

Title: Is Dental Work After Radiation for Head, Neck Cancer Safe?
Teaser: Post-radiation dental extractions posed an elevated risk for exposed bone and osteoradionecrosis in patients with head and neck cancer.

Title: Food Allergies Plateau But GPs Need More Tools
Teaser: Most food allergies are managed in primary care but general practitioners lack support and tools.

Title: Invasive Strategy May Not Save Older Patients With NSTEMI
Teaser: It might result in fewer non-fatal infarctions, however.

Title: Parkinson's Risk in Women and History of Migraine: New Data
Teaser: A new cohort study found no association between a history of migraine and increased risk for Parkinson's disease in women.

Title: Meat Consumption Tied to Higher Type 2 Diabetes Risk
Teaser: Global data from more than one million people finds a significant link, particularly with processed meat and unprocessed red meat, across populations.

Title: AI-Based Breast Cancer Screening Will Save Lives & Money
Teaser: Most benefit is from risk-stratified screening, with annual screening for high-risk individuals to every 6 years for those at lowest risk.

Title: Demographics Linked to Worse Access to Cardiac Surgery
Teaser: Women, Black people, and poor people were less likely to undergo major heart surgery.

Title: Monthly Semaglutide Goal: The End of Daily Pills?
Teaser: An injectable hydrogel provided a sustained release of semaglutide for 1 month in rats, according to preclinical testing of an experimental longer-acting formulation.

Title: Join Dr Julie Oliver and the Primary Care Women’s Health Forum at Guidelines Live 2024
Teaser: In anticipation of Guidelines Live 2024, the PCWHF provides a taster of its sessions in the Women’s Health Stream, which will address key issues around menopause and HRT

Title: Rheumatoid Arthritis: Whole-Food Diet May Be Protective
Teaser: The more ultra-processed foods a person consumed, the higher their risk for the inflammatory autoimmune disease.

Title: Bariatric Surgery Before Pregnancy Tied to Premature Infants
Teaser: Bariatric surgery before pregnancy was associated with a higher risk for premature and small for gestational age infants.

Title: GP Respiratory Consults Overcome Perfect Storm
Teaser: As GP consults for respiratory tract infections increased, antibiotic prescriptions declined.

Title: High Temperatures Also Exacerbate Raynaud, Study Suggests
Teaser: Both extreme heat and cold were tied to more severe episodes of Raynaud phenomenon in a study of participants with systemic sclerosis.

Title: Vitamin D Testing and Supplementation in Healthy People: What Does the Evidence Say?
Teaser: Dr Pam Brown examines the updated Endocrine Society guideline on vitamin D, highlighting the practice-changing recommendations for UK primary care
